definition[0]: to close or repair something by sewing it
example[0]: Could you sew up this hole in my trousers?
definition[1]: to finish a business agreement or plan and get the result you want
example[1]: The deal should be sewn up in a week.
explanation[0]: Sew up is usually passive in this meaning
definition[2]: to have gained control over a situation so that you are sure to win or get what you want
example[2]: It looks like the Democrats have the election sewn up.
definition[3]: to agree to a plan or arrangement with someone which will give you both the result you want
example[3]: The two banks have sewn up their plans to divide the retail banking system between them.
definition[4]: to get control of a situation so that you are certain to gain an advantage from it
example[4]: They had the market so sewn up that the salesmen hardly had to try to sell the products at all.
